medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute periumbilical abdominal pain with migration to the right lower quadrant.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient developed acute onset periumbilical abdominal pain around 2pm yesterday afternoon, described as very sudden and sharp. There was subsequent migration of the discomfort towards the right lower quadrant, but the pain in the periumbilical region did not resolve. The patient denies any nausea, vomiting, fever, or chills. Notably, there was an absence of appetite since the onset of the pain.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypothyroidism; previous left wrist surgery and right knee surgery.
